intro: Ctenitopsis subsageniacea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ctenitopsis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, compound leaves that are typically arranged in a whorled pattern. Its flowers are small and white, clustered in umbels, and it blooms during the cooler months. This species is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, showing some degree of drought tolerance.
